keyTakeAways: Kevin Federline is releasing a memoir titled 'You Thought You Knew' to share his personal experiences with Britney Spears, motivated by his concern for the well-being of their two sons.
The memoir includes controversial and salacious details about Spears' behavior, such as her actions during pregnancy and while breastfeeding, and claims she mocked and once punched their son Preston.
Federline alleges that Spears engaged in substance abuse, including cocaine use, during the time when their sons were breastfeeding, which caused him significant distress.
The sons, Preston and Jayden, have little contact with their mother and have told their father stories of fear, such as finding her standing in the doorway with a knife.
Britney Spears responded to the memoir by accusing Federline of gaslighting and claiming that the book contains 'white lies' that harm her reputation and mental health.

Federline states that the book was written as a public plea for Spears to seek mental health support and acknowledges that the 'Free Britney' movement, while well-intentioned, may have contributed to a hostile environment around her.
The memoir will be released on the audiobook platform Listenin and includes personal reflections on Federline's upbringing, career in dance, and his journey as a father and ex-husband.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Kevin Federline is releasing a memoir titled 'You Thought You Knew', detailing his tumultuous relationship with Britney Spears, including allegations of substance abuse, emotional neglect, and abusive behavior toward their two sons, Preston and Jayden. He claims these experiences were deeply traumatic and motivated his decision to write the book to help his children move forward. The memoir includes personal anecdotes, such as the night they first met and Spears' alleged drinking and cocaine use during pregnancy and breastfeeding. Spears responded by accusing Federline of gaslighting and fabricating false stories. Federline also criticizes the 'Free Britney' movement, stating it harmed public perception and created a hostile environment. The book is being released on the audiobook platform Listenin and reflects his personal journey as a father and former husband.
title: Kevin Federline Releases Memoir on Britney Spears, Accusing Her of Abuse and Neglect
